text: I dislike scrolling through. I type whenever I can

Hi folks! We are using the _unofficial_ custom modules API to create modules, which works fine for old modules but we’re trying to make it work with the new IDE. 

After updating the fields / structure based on the new modules, creating a new module works but the module still triggers the “Upgrade module” popup and it doesn’t show up under `/modules` (FTP). Is there an API endpoint we need to call to register the module as a new module and to create the module folder?

What are the latest news about HubSpot Data Center in Germany ?
We have a government lead that absolutely need to have datas in Europe.
Can we be sure that if we sign this account its data will be store in Europe ? 
Thanks all
Is there any _unofficial_ documentation for the CM API?
No problem Tony! Please let us know if you want any of your customer portals added for the new Design Manager.
There isn’t :disappointed:

yup I expected that
Are you using v4? or which API version for CMs?
`<https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets>`
same they are using now for the new IDE
did you tried to auto-upgrade with the API after the creation?

something like
<https://api.HubSpot.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets/{{CM_ID}}/buffer/upgrade?portalId={{PORTAL_ID}}>"

and then pushing to live (need to republish after upgrade):
<https://api.HubSpot.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets/{{CM_ID}}/push-buffer-live?portalId={{PORTAL_ID}}>
that’s probably what I need — will give this a try, thanks! :beers:
didn't tried so let me know if that works :smile:
will do :slightly_smiling_face:
I am thinking that maybe you need to add some POST fields for the upgrade as you need to choose for which environment it's going to be available the CM (page, blog and/or email)
<@U6Z3FRJ2D> what was the biggest pain point going enterprise?

yup, I found it:
supportedContentTypes is the field
the values:
PAGE, BLOG, EMAIL
you can add `hostTemplateTypes` to the CM when you create it
oh nice
I would chat with your Account Manager about this
It’s what I did :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks
Which is fine. So you don't use the dropdown either? Just the search box?
permisions, all the people can edit all the things :S

Hi all, we just added a few new keyboard commands to the new Design Manager to increase your efficiency. We wrote up this blog post to give you a quick run down of the new features <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/keyboard-shortcuts-for-cms-development-efficiencies>
UH, so in the new FORM ui, how do I prevent HubSpot styles from coming through?
When someone updates the form in this new editor it is adding the default styles and I can't figure out where this is at
And to elaborate, I am able to do this with the embed code, but can't find the option to do it inside the form.
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9YRP3DK9/image.png|image.png>
after removing the embedded stylesheet the JS pulls in it is fine
*in the old design manager how do you create a new global module?* I totally forgot how
I remember the old interface was removed without replacing it, but there was still some workaround way to do it
Starting to think that functionality is completely gone in the old design manager… this really bites..
<@U22PWJ41G> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U22PWJ41G/F9XV8RFK7/screen_shot_2018-03-28_at_4.56.09_pm.png|Screen Shot 2018-03-28 at 4.56.09 PM.png>
Hi Nicholas, can you provide an example of this?
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
omg the caching is killing me right now

I’m actively working on a page and it’s flashing back to showing old styles and and crap as I’m working on it making it really stinking hard. It randomly works  sometimes, I’m using the query urls but it’s getting really tedious
add ?123 to your url
then command+L, right arrow, 23 <enter?
>
this is all i'm doing right now for every redfresh
yea it’s not caring really it randomly shows me what my styles looked like from 15 mins ago then i have to change query urls again
it’s aweful
<@U7SL518D6> that has happened to me a few times today too - as if I’ve gone back in time
But then will randomly show up fine again shortly after (or as soon as I tell someone :joy:)
that’s practically what’s happening

I think interestingly enough the query parameters are making the situation worse. The page I’m working on has filters that rely on query parameters in order to display some content. so in order to view the content I’m styling I HAVE to have them in the url, I add an extra gobbledegook one just to keep refreshing but doesn’t seem to help. It’s so frustrating I thought someone else was editing the stylesheet at the same time as me causing conflicts but nope just caching.
<@U22PU4G4A> :point_up_2: just want to make sure your seeing this...
<@U7SL518D6> can you provide some examples? We can look at what’s going on.
Jeff I'll DM you the link to the page i was working on
